translation: The book Wanshan tonggui ji is beneficial to further study and is really not a minor supplement.

source_sentence: 志於道者，舍此而他求，如繪無形之太虛，補無跡之疾風，徒弊精神，未見其有成也。
translation: If someone who is dedicated to the path were to abandon it and seek alternatives, it would be like painting the immaterial Taixu and mending the traceless Gale, which only spoils the spirit and fails to show its accomplishment.

source_sentence: 諦思其義，法而行之，不惟不負於禪師著書，指迷之功；抑亦不負於區區重行鏤板之用心也，願勿以徒遮眼而已。
translation: When you consider their meaning and practice them according to the Dharma, you won't only be worthy of the Zen master's work of writing and pointing out the confusion, but also worthy of the intention to revive the practice of chalkboard in various districts.

source_sentence: 成化戊戌秋嘉禾真如講寺比丘如[承/巳]識　　流虹興聖禪寺比丘德海書　　四明王鴻刊　徐均祥助筆附永明壽禪師垂誡(按舊本不載此誡，今從佛祖綱目考訂，以其針劄宗門人，最為痛切，故附錄于后)學道之門，別無奇特，只要洗滌根塵下無量劫來業識種子。
translation: Chenghua Wuxu Qiu Jiahezhenru Dianji Biqi Ru [Cheng / Si] Shi Liuhong Xingshing Chanji Biqi Dehai shou Siming Wang Hongkan Xu Junxiang assisted in writing the accompanying Yongming Shou Chanji zhizhu (according to the old text, which did not contain this precept, but now we have examined it from the outline of the Buddha's ancestors, because it pinpoints the people of the sect and is most painful, so it is appended at the end) The gate of the path of training is nothing special, except to cleanse the roots and dust of the seeds of karmic consciousnesses that have existed for measureless eons.

source_sentence: 汝等但能消除情念，斷絕妄緣，對世間一切愛欲境界，心如木石相似；直饒未明道眼，自然成就淨身。
translation: If you can remove thoughts of feeling and cut off deluded perceptual objects, your minds will be like wood and stone when it comes to all worldly desires and objects; it will naturally lead to the attainment of a pure body when you haven't yet clarified the eye of the Way.

source_sentence: 若逢真正導師，切須勤心親近；假使參而未徹，學而未成，歷在耳根，永為道種，世世不落惡趣，生生不失人身；纔出頭來，一聞千悟。
translation: If you meet a true teacher, you must diligently approach him; even if you study but don't penetrate him and learn but don't accomplish him, he'll always be a seed of the path if he remains in your ear faculties, never falling into bad destinies from generation to generation and never losing his person in birth; he'll suddenly emerge from his position and become enlightened by the thousand things he hears.

source_sentence: 須信道，真善知識是人中最大因緣，能化眾生得見佛性。
translation: You must believe that true, good teachers are the greatest cause among people and can teach sentient beings to see the buddha-nature.

source_sentence: 深嗟末世誑說一禪，只學虛頭，全無實解。
translation: Deeply regretting the fact that in this late age you can preach a single dhyāna, you only train in vain and have no real understanding.

source_sentence: 步步行有，口口談空。
translation: They practice existence step by step and talk about emptiness verbally.

source_sentence: 自不責業力所牽，更教人撥無因果。
translation: They don't blame themselves for being tied by the power of karma, and they teach others to deny the absence of cause and effect.

source_sentence: 便說飲酒食肉，不礙菩提；行盜行婬，無妨般若，生遭王法，死墮阿鼻。
translation: They then say that drinking wine and eating meat doesn't hinder enlightenment, that stealing and committing sexual misconduct doesn't hinder prajñā, that birth is condemned to the king's law, and that death is condemned to abhidharma.

source_sentence: 受得地獄業消，又入畜生餓鬼，百千萬劫無有出期。
translation: After suffering the extinction of hell-bound karma, they'll be reborn as animals or hungry ghosts for a hundred million eons with no hope of escape.

source_sentence: 除非一念回光，立即翻邪為正。
translation: Unless one thought brings back the light, he'll immediately change what's wrong into what's right.

source_sentence: 若不自懺、自悔、自修，諸佛出來也無救爾處。
translation: If someone doesn't repent, confess, and cultivate on their own, there's no place for them to be saved even if the buddhas come out.

source_sentence: 若割心肝如木石相似，便可食肉；若飲酒如屎尿相似，便可飲酒；若見端正男女如死屍相似，便可行婬；若見己財如糞土相似，便可偷盜。
translation: If you cut your heart and liver like wood and stone, you can eat meat; if you drink alcohol like feces and urine, you can drink alcohol; if you see a decent man and woman like dead corpses, you can commit sexual misconduct; and if you see your possessions like dirt, you can steal them.

source_sentence: 饒爾煉得至此田地，亦未可順汝意在，直待證無量聖身，始可行世間逆順事。
translation: Even if you've refined yourself to this point, you still can't conform to your wishes until you realize the immeasurable noble body, then you'll be able to do worldly misdeeds.

source_sentence: 古聖施設，豈有他心？
translation: How could there be other minds when the sages of yore made this designation?

source_sentence: 只為末法僧尼，少持禁戒，恐賺向善俗子，多退道心，所以廣行遮護。
translation: It's just that at the end of the age, monks and nuns rarely observe the forbidden precepts, and they're afraid that many well-intentioned laypeople will retreat from the path, so they practice extensive protection.

source_sentence: 千經所說，萬論所陳，若不去婬，斷一切清淨種；若不去酒，斷一切智慧種；若不去盜，斷一切福德種；若不去肉，斷一切慈悲種。
translation: As explained in a thousand sūtras and ten thousand treatises, if you don't remove sexual misconduct, it cuts off all seeds of purity; if you don't remove alcohol, it cuts off all seeds of wisdom; if you don't remove stealing, it cuts off all seeds of merit; and if you don't remove meat, it cuts off all seeds of compassion.

source_sentence: 三世諸佛，同口敷宣；天下禪宗，一音演暢。
translation: All the buddhas of the three times spoke together and declared it, and the whole world's Chan school spoke with one voice.

source_sentence: 如何後學，略不聽從，自毀正因，反行魔說？
translation: How could a late-student not heed this, disparage the right cause, and instead practice what Māra teaches?

source_sentence: 只為宿薰業種，生遇邪師，善力易消，惡根難拔。
translation: It's only because of the seeds of long-perpetuated karma and encountering an evil teacher in the formative years that good forces are easily sapped and bad roots are difficult to uproot.

source_sentence: 豈不見，古聖道：「見一魔事，如萬箭攢心；聞一魔聲，如千錐劄耳。」
translation: Haven't you seen the ancient sage teaching, "Seeing one demonic deed is like 10,000 arrows lodged in your heart, and hearing one demonic sound is like a thousand cones striking your ears?"

source_sentence: 速須遠離，不可見聞。
translation: You must quickly distance yourself from it; you mustn't see or hear it.

source_sentence: 各自究心，慎莫容易，久立珍重。
translation: Each should investigate his own mind, be careful not to make it easy, and take care to establish it for a long time.
